title: Woodford woes deter investors from long-term bets on UK tech
text:
Investors are being put off making long-term bets on British businesses by the turmoil surrounding Neil Woodford, the Government’s development bank has warned.

Catherine Lewis La Torre, the chief executive of the Government’s British Patient Capital arm, said: “It definitely has repercussions in terms of the image of patient capital, which is unfortunate.

“In terms of our goal to persuade institutional investors that this is a good place to be investing, it makes that task harder.”
